Fuzzy Cryptography¶

Fuzzy cryptography based on Juels & Wattenberg Scheme “Fuzzy Commitment”

platform:Linux
synopsis:Fuzzy cryptography
crypto_fuzzy_jw.JW_commit(x, m=15, n=20, symsize=8)¶

Juels Wattenberg based function to make a fuzzy commitment

m,n,symsize initializes Reed-Solomon-Code with .
  • m – Messages
  • n – Codewords
  • Initializes Set of Codewords C
Parameters:
  • x (list) – Input key x.
  • m – Parameter for Reed-Solomon-Code.
  • n – Parameter for Reed-Solomon-Code.
  • symsize – Parameter for Reed-Solomon-Code.
Returns:

hash – Hash of c.
Returns:

delta – Difference between x and c.
Returns:

c – Randomly generated codeword .
crypto_fuzzy_jw.JW_decommit(hash, delta, x2, m=15, n=20, symsize=8)¶

Juels Wattenberg function to decommit a fuzzy commitment

m,n,symsize initializes Reed-Solomon-Code with .
  • m – Messages
  • n – Codewords
  • Initializes Set of Codewords C
Parameters:
  • hash – Hash of c from Alice.
  • delta – Difference from Alice.
  • x2 – Own input key x2. Slightly different from Alice x.
  • m – Parameter for Reed-Solomon-Code.
  • n – Parameter for Reed-Solomon-Code.
  • symsize – Parameter for Reed-Solomon-Code.
Returns:

c2 – Decommited c2
Returns:

corrections – List of corrections made by Reed-Solomon
Raise :

RuntimeError
crypto_fuzzy_jw.safe_random(length, symsize=8)¶

get random list of secified length with symbol size of symsize

Parameters:
  • length – Length of generated list.
  • symsize – Size of symbols bits.
Returns:

urandom_list – The generated list.
